tweet: Merry Christmas from the Jones Family! pic.twitter.com/hGvhUbT9rh
3/3: In essence, my vote tonight was a vote to proceed to find common ground. It is only by finding common ground that we can fulfill our duty to govern effectively. -Doug

2/3: Working w/ @SenBobCorker & @JeffFlake, and leadership of both parties, a commitment was forged that we would proceed with debate but that no further votes would be taken until an agreement is reached that would pass both houses of Congress and be signed by the President.

1/3: On Wednesday, the Senate passed with unanimous bipartisan support a bill that would have funded the federal government. Unfortunately, the House sent us a bill that clearly could not earn the necessary votes to pass in the Senate. pic.twitter.com/YmxX1DqNuq

GREAT news — the House just passed Senator Jones’ Civil Rights Cold Case Records Collection Act! Now it heads to the President’s desk. 

Sen. Jones worked w/ @SenTedCruz & @RepBobbyRush on this bipartisan effort. 

Read their statement here:  https://sen.gov/OO83  pic.twitter.com/IjFQxuH8Ie

I agree – more prisons aren’t the answer. In the Senate, we just passed the #FirstStepAct to begin reforming our criminal justice system, but we need leaders to step up at the state and local levels, too. -Doug https://twitter.com/dothaneagle/status/1075148746143514624 …

With the #FirstStepAct, we have an opportunity to make history by working together to solve one of the most important, most challenging issues of our time. I urge the Senate to take the first step by passing this vital legislation. – Doug pic.twitter.com/A6SbjoeNia

I understand how important it is to confront the darkest moments in our history so we can begin to heal together. I thank @tedcruz for his partnership in passing this bill in the Senate this evening & look forward to seeing this bill through the House & to the President. – Doug https://twitter.com/SenDougJones/status/1045050544304390144 …

As a recreational fisherman myself, I knew I wanted to be a part of this effort to bring our fisheries management practices into the 21st century. This is a smart policy change that will protect our fish stocks & support a vital part of our state’s economy. - Doug https://twitter.com/sportfishpolicy/status/1074768968378920960 …

Great news for Alabama farmers hurt by China’s retaliatory tariffs. @USDA will launch a 2nd round of relief payments following a letter from Senator Jones & @SenJohnHoeven.
